attributes.comment:
This is to registered my complaint about the proposed USCIS increase in fees. I'm
opposed to fees increasing for all the petitions at USCIS, but the adoption fees
affect me personally because I am the pre-adoptive mother of an abandoned 20-
month old child in Guatemala who I am waiting and waiting for.

Fees for adoption should be held because they are high enough and many
adoptive parents also have to file and pay TWICE because the approval
is only good for 18 months and international adoptions are taking longer and
longer.

I am paying a huge sum of money in total to adopt my child in Guatemala. Here
is what it costs just to file with USCIS to adopt:

What it used to be when adoptions took place within 18 months:
I600A: $545
Fingerprints: $70 x 2 = $140
Total: $685

What it will be now that adoptions are taking longer plus the increase:
I600A: $670 x 2 = $1340
Fingerprints: $80 x 4 = $ 320
Total: $1660

That's an increase of $975, or over 140%! And that's not even taking into
consideration the fact that applying for our child's Certificate of Citizenship (for IR4
visas) goes from $215 to $460, a difference of $245 or about 120% increase.
Sometimes, adoptive parents don't even get the certificates for a year after filing!

It is outrageous and unfair to raise USCIS fees for well-meaning people who just
want to do something good for themselves and for children who need that.

Sincerely,

Madeleine Nash
attributes.title: Comment Submitted by Pre Adoptive Parent, Madeline Nash
